qas.question: How many legions in five bases were along the Rhine by the Romans?
What did the number of legions in Roman times depend on?

answers.text: whether a state or threat of war existed
whether a state or threat of war existed

qas.question: Vetra and I Germanica and XX Valeria were the two legions for what?
What was the Colonia Agrippina's original name?
What does Colonia Agrippina's original name translate into?
How many wars did the Romans have along the Rhine?
When was the first Roman war?
How many legions for the Germania Inferior existed?
What legion did the Romans enter from the other side of the empire?
Who were the Pannonian troops allies with?

context: The Romans kept eight legions in five bases along the Rhine. The actual number of legions present at any base or in all, depended on whether a state or threat of war existed. Between about AD 14 and 180, the assignment of legions was as follows: for the army of Germania Inferior, two legions at Vetera (Xanten), I Germanica and XX Valeria (Pannonian troops); two legions at oppidum Ubiorum ("town of the Ubii"), which was renamed to Colonia Agrippina, descending to Cologne, V Alaudae, a Celtic legion recruited from Gallia Narbonensis and XXI, possibly a Galatian legion from the other side of the empire.
